Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: buniee311
Reviews.Content: Took a trip to Phoenix for vacation/sightseeing and needed a inexpensive place to stay for a night before continuing my vacation. The staff was helpful, although not overly. The room was clean, but there was nothing special about it. I had no real issues or complaints about my stay, other than that the surrounding area was not exactly pleasant. For a one night, inexpensive, no frills attached place to stay, I can say that I was satisfied ...but there is room for improvement!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Infrequenttraveler07
Reviews.Content: We had mistakenly not booked one night of our week long Spring Training vacation. We were in Tucson heading back to Phoenix and started stopping 50 miles from Phoenix to find a place. There was nothing to be had any where. My husband finally suggested we go to the seediest part of town and find a motel/hotel. This is where we landed. It was pretty awful but under the circumstances we were relieved. The ice machine was broken but under the circumstances I really needed a drink. Drove across the street (never walk here!) and got ice. Took my glassful and the desk clerk graciously accepted the rest of the 10 pound bag. I believe sleeping in the car would have been worse (but not sure) Still we will laugh about it many years from now.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible !!!!”
Reviews.Author: hafniaa
Reviews.Content: It was really bad .... I found rat excrement in the floor, bed and on the base of the air conditioning, also, many death insects in the bathroom. It should be closed by the health department.

Reviews.Title: “roaches checked in I checked out”
Reviews.Author: fries007
Reviews.Content: 5-6 roaches in my room. i was moved then saw another i slept that night in a chair. tv got few stations some unclear. i paid for a week stay. manager says main office will decide on refund. now im told even if i didnt stay i cant get my $ back. im going to fight this of course

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location, Made my trip an easy one”
Reviews.Author: BIGBIZTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Phoenix for a last minute business trip. I was able to get a clean, decent room at a great price last minute. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for my meeting. I would highly recommend this hotel any day of the week. For the money it gets a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Come Here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jbunlimited
Reviews.Content: First off I went to the place on 12/20/2007. I drove up and it seemed to be a decent place for the price. When I went inside the lady at the front desk was dressed in shabby clothing and was completely rude to me. I ignored the fact that she was rude since I was tired and just needed a room after a long drive from Sacramento. I paid in cash and was given the key to the room. When I went up to the room it was in terrible condition. The door was open and when I had peeked inside I saw the room to be a complete mess. It smelt of urine and the bed looked slept in. I went back down to the office moments after renting the room and explained to the lady that the room was a reck and that I do not feel safe staying there. I simple just wanted my money back so I could go elsewhere to feel safe. She completely refused to speak with me and told me I must leave the office at once or she would call the police for harassment. Shocked and not sure what to do at this point I left. My son and my nephew both tried calling to reason with her and she simple said there is nothing to talk about and hung up. I called the next day 12/21/2007 to speak to a manager. The person on the phone sounded like the same person from last night. She would not give me her name but stated she is a manager and said that she would not give me the money back nor would she talk to me concerning this matter. After a few minutes trying to talk to her she hung up stating "There is nothing more to discuss". I do not recommend staying there. I would suggest that your better off sleeping on the streets or in your car then staying at the Sterling International Hotel. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “close this dump”
Reviews.Author: markupWestCoast
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed with all the hotel rating sites that still list this dump. It should be closed by the health department. It is untrue to give it even 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable not clean at all”
Reviews.Author: elginwatch
Reviews.Content: this was the nightmare we wish we had not experienced. This location was very unsavory. The appointments were grimey with filth. The desk clerk worn a filthly and ragged sweat suit. We were sent here by US Airways because they caused us to miss our connection with a late arrival from San Francisco to Phoenix. That night we left the Sterling Inn preferring to sleep in the clean and much safer airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jwapp
Reviews.Content: I booked this room because there was a sporting event in Phoenix which caused there to be nothing else available. Boy, was I sorry! I should've come the next day, when the event was over and I could've chosen another hotel. By the way, they term it a hotel, but it's actually a cheesy motel! I checked in and discovered that my room was filthy--the carpet was so gross I wouldn't take my socks off and I wrote my name in the dust on the table! Get this straight--my home is not so clean, as I have 4 dogs and 6 cats, and I was disgusted by this motel! There was no welcoming literature of any kind (what to do and where to eat in Phoenix, welcome to our hotel, etc), no Internet service, no remote for the TV, and no speakers in the TV! There was an ironing board, but no iron. I had to visit the office twice to obtain one. Speaking of the office, the three young girls I encountered there were all wearing hooded sweatshirts (one of which was visibly dirty with holes in it)--very unprofessional! To top off my stay, my card was charged twice for one night! I realize that the $50 per night (I only stayed one night--I got the heck out of there) was dirt cheap for Phoenix, but they could give this place a little more effort and improve it dramatically.

Reviews.Title: “not even a decient experience”
Reviews.Author: sfreud
Reviews.Content: Me and my soon tot be husband stayed at this hotel for an early flight out, i booked in the internet and i thought i saw it said a 4star. boy was i wrong. The hotel area verry scarry. the staff was OK not too nice. we were put on the 2nd floor. when we got to our room the towel rack was falling off the wall, the smoke detector was not there (just exposed wires for the wall). we stayed anyway only because we got in late and had an early flight and didn't know the area. about 6 months later i was checking my credit card account (the card i used to secure the room rate not the one i used at checkout) and noticed a $112 charge. when i called the manager she gave me a # to there account to sort things out...go figure wrong # then i was given a fax # i faxed a letter to the "accountant". i have gotten no were. i finally decided to go to my bank and file a claim. BE WORNED NOT TO USE A CREDIT CARD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liars, Cheaters, what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place uses plastic bags of batting, covered with a pillowcase, as their pillows. Every piece of furniture has cigarette burns. I decided to check out rather than stay in this dump and they billed my credit card for 2 nights anyway. When I disputed it, they said I stayed the whole 2 days and left my key in the room rather than checkout. These people should not be allowed to list this dive in any internet search.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Miserable, Never Stay there!”
Reviews.Author: ctg280
Reviews.Content: One look at this place should have told me to keep going, but it is very convenient to the airport car rental return area, and with early flight, we figured how bad could one night be??? This is the worst hotel ever... i checked in and the staff was so miserably rude, unhelpful and downright nasty that i checked right out.. they gave me a hard time about not staying there, and will probably be fighting with my credit card company forever to get the charge removed. I would sleep in my car before I stayed in this dump. There is a very nice travel lodge just about a mile up the street, just as close to the airport and far preferable.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked a car rental (no complaints there), which is located in the "lobby" of the Sterling. As per an earlier review it was a Ho Jo's at some point in its past - the car rental maps list it as such. The moment you pull into the place you realize you should have gone elsewhere. I'm sure glad all I was doing was picking a car - I would hate like hell to have to stay there. We waited for a cab to take us to the Airport so spent about 10-15 minutes waiting. Somebody who worked for the joint had to go and speak to few dudes partaking in drugs in the back parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: SabineS
Reviews.Content: dirty rooms(we found dirty underwear in the bathroom )... unfriendly staff... noisy... just terrible. don´t stay there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand name, Outdated motel”
Reviews.Author: MrWHCanton_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Advertised as an International Hotel near the airport and naming itself Sterling, it claimed three and a half stars. Whoever awarded them must have been on a trip to the stars at the time. The half star alone would have been exorbitant praise. This place is a not very well remodeled, vintage motel. There are signs it may have been a Howard Johnson motel or a Day's Inn in more prosperous times. The electric switches were temperamental. They had to be held firmly to assure contact. The room might have been cleaned with a vacuum cleaner sometime during the past month. When a call was place to the desk because of insufficient towels and cups, the clerk reported that she did not have any more cups. The SI is right next to a Motel Six. Stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “T-e-r-r-i-b-l-e”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel just proves the theory of "You get what you pay for" is correct. Holes in the drapes, holes in the bed sheets, old moldy Q-tips in the bathroom on the floor (had been there awhile), enough dust on the tables to do an excavation, no toilet paper in the bathrooms and no towels (had to wait awhile to get those after I called). Then, their restaurant. It should tell you when your the only customer at 830AM. The service.. I believe in giving someone a couple chances, but these people (yes, more than one) were not the brightest people in the world. Needless to say, the food was terrible! I got my children a doughnut... pretty simple item... Expensive paper weights! Never again! Pay a little extra and go elsewhere...

HotelInfo.Name: Sterling International Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: 124 South 24th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85034
